questions.text: Which of these would Donkey Kong eat last?
questions.additionalText:
They're all varieties of banana, barring 'Granny Smith', which is a type of apple. A 2010 study in the 
The National Center for Biotechnology Information established that apes prefer pieces of banana over apples.

questions.text: At which of these Olympic locations have Mario & Sonic not made joint appearances?
questions.additionalText: The first game in the series was 'Mario & Sonic At The Athens 2004 Olympic Games' - prior to that, e.g. Sydney 2000, Mario and Sonic were seen as rivals for being the mascots of Nintendo and SEGA respectively.

questions.text: Which of these TV shows has not had a dance stolen by Fortnite?
questions.additionalText: 'Fresh', 'Jubilation', and 'Dance Moves' are the real in-game emotes from the other three shows.

questions.text: Which of these MOBAs has the most playable characters?
questions.additionalText: Also known as 'heroes' and 'champions', League has 159, whereas Dota 2 has 123, SMITE has 119, and HotS has 90.

questions.text: What was the "life-changing" prize for winning Peter Molyneux's experimental 2013 video game 'Curiosity'?
questions.additionalText:
The game setting was a white room in the middle of which floated a giant cube made of billions of smaller cubes. Players tapped the cube to dig through the surface of each layer and reveal the next layer below. The goal was to reach the centre and to discover what was inside.

The winner was identified as Edinburgh resident Bryan Henderson, who didn't even know there was a prize, and was ultimately barely contacted by the studio (whose next game 'Godus' was a flop) and therefore could not claim his winnings of a 1% revenue share.

Indie publisher Devolver Digital made Henderson a non-playable character in their game 'Not a Hero'.

options.b: A lead role and revenue from his next game

questions.text: Which of these live action video game movies has the highest Metacritic rating?
questions.additionalText: Detective Pikachu has a rating of 53 on Metacritic. The highest scoring live action video game movie is 'Werewolves Within' with 66, followed by 'Mortal Kombat' with 60.

questions.text: Which sport has Queen Elizabeth II played on Prince William's Nintendo Wii?
questions.additionalText:
In a 2008 tabloid article titled "MAKE WAY FOR THE Q Wii N", a "Palace source" told 'The People': "when she saw William playing a game after lunch at Sandringham she thought the Nintendo looked tremendous fun and begged to join in. She played a simple ten-pin bowling game and by all accounts was a natural.".

Publisher THQ attempted to gift the Queen as gold-plated Wii, but it was rejected and ultimately sold when the company went bust.

questions.text: In which of these games can you currently not pet a dog?
questions.additionalText:
Ghost of Tsushima received an update that added this ability, following good-natured jibes from Tristan Cooper's Twitter account @CanYouPetTheDog.

Speaking with IGN on the subject, Zelda game director Hidemaro Fujibayashi said: “In the game it seems like you can do anything, but ... you actually have a pretty limited number of actions that can do a ton of different things,” Fujibayashi told IGN. “So if it came down to something like petting a dog, we would actually have to put in a custom action just for petting a dog that couldn't really be used for anything else.".

You can however feed the dogs, for which they may lead you to treasure!

options.a: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild

questions.text: Which of these in-game currencies would be worth the most when exchanged for real-world currency?
questions.additionalText:
This is based on a GameRant article whereby the author found similar items across all games, e.g. T-Shirts and Bottled Drinks, and did some maths. The Sims is supposed to be an analogue to real life, whereas you need several hundreds of the other currencies to buy simple in-game items. In Pokémon a lemonade costs 300 Pokédollars.

A rupee is worth roughly $0.50
A bell is worth roughly $0.01
A pokédollar is worth roughly $0.05
A simoleon is worth $1.29

In The Sims 3, a 2011 Ford Fiesta Hatchback will cost the player §12,000, with a real-world MSRP $15,500.

questions.text: Which of these is the highest Professional Sports Authenticator (PSA) grade shorthand a trading card can achieve?
questions.additionalText: PSA are the choice grader for most collectors of cards. The terms used originate from coin grading used by historians. 'GEM-MT' means 'Gem Mint', and is at the top of the scale, with 'N' meaning 'No Grade' due to tampering or questionable authenticity.

questions.text: Which of these famous classical compositions, which plays upon death in the 1975 Western shooter 'Gun Fight', was the first to ever appear in a video game?
questions.additionalText: 'Marche Funebre' is Italian for 'Death March', however, there's another, more practical reason for the game's use of Chopin: music in early video games was usually the dominion of an engineer, not a musician, and as such, it was much easier to transcribe a piece of out-of-copyright, pre-existing music into code than attempt to compose a tune afresh.

questions.text: In what region was the 'Monkey Island' in 'The Secret of Monkey Island'?
questions.additionalText: The program that the game's artists used to create characters was called Deluxe Paint, and it saved files as "brush" files. When drawing the main character, he was saved as guy.brush, hence his name 'Guybrush'.

questions.text: Which of these 81's is true?
questions.additionalText:
According to a 2021 CI Games & E-sports survey of a representative sample of online population aged 10-65.

Minecraft made WAY more than $81 million in 2020. Elden Ring only has 5 active speed running categories on 'speedrun.com'.

options.b: Elden Ring has 81 different speedrun categories
options.d: The oldest ever gaming YouTuber is 81 years old

questions.text: If you were using a boosted account with high ELO in CSGO, but were being pubstomped in a ranked DM, which of these things could you be described as doing?
questions.additionalText:
The term 'smurfing' comes from two Warcraft II players back in the '90s. They were so good at the game that when other players saw their usernames come up in matchmaking, they would often leave to avoid getting crushed. To get around this, these players created alternate accounts to keep their identity hidden. They chose the names 'PapaSmurf' and 'Smurfette', which led to the terminology used today.

So, if 'smurfing' is a seemingly low-level player behaving like a high-level player, then the reverse - a high-level player acting like a low-level player, is "reverse smurfing".

questions.text: A former Nintendo of America VP made E3 history in 2004, with the introduction: "My name is Reggie..."
questions.additionalText:
In an interview later, he said: "This was a well-considered statement, and reflected the needs of Nintendo at the time, and the reality of my own personality. My enthusiasm for video games, my love for Nintendo franchises, as well as my approachability, all worked together. This is the real Reggie… whether on stage, in the office or engaging with the community. I think this is why fans welcomed me, and continue to enjoy engaging with me."

He also said: "My kids have never let me live it down.".

options.a: "I've been trying to reach you about your car's extended warranty."
options.b: "I'm not really much of a gamer, but I am a fan of Chess."
options.c: "Are you ready? My body is ready."
options.d: "I'm about kicking ass, I'm about taking names, and we're about making games."

questions.text: Which of these is not a real post title on the Steam community forum for the game 'Planet Coaster'?
questions.additionalText: Hopefully hinted by the fact that there aren't any animals in 'Planet Coaster', but there are in the follow-up game 'Planet Zoo'.

options.a: My elephants keep escaping and blocking the park entrance
options.b: Why are my guests such pathetic cheapskates?
options.c: Is there a mod or cheat that allows you to kill or drown the visitors?
options.d: Why Planet Coaster Needs A Military DLC

questions.text: Which former member of Californian rap group N.W.A. made an appearance in the 'Call of Duty' franchise?
questions.additionalText:
The rapper, who has also appeared in comedy films such as '21 Jump Street', 'Are We There Yet', and 'Barbershop', also played a minor role as Joseph Bowman in the 2010 'Call of Duty: Black Ops'. Unfortunately, the character dies in the game.

Snoop Dogg was never a member of N.W.A.

questions.text: Which of these fast food chains have never had an officially licensed video game?
questions.additionalText:
Burger King: Sneak King
Taco Bell: Taco Bell Tasty Temple Challenge
KFC: I Love You, Colonel Sanders!

questions.text: Sony's brand name is a portmanteau between the word 'sonus', meaning 'sound' in Latin, and what other word?
questions.additionalText:
The desire to change the name to 'Sony' from it's original 'Tokyo Tsushin Kogyo' was to prevent a clash of acronyms with the railway company 'Tokyo Kyuko', and help Western audiences read and pronounce it. 'Sonny', a loan word into Japanese which in the early 1950s connoted smart and presentable young men, was chosen as the company wanted to "represent a very small group of young people who have the energy and passion towards unlimited creations and innovative ideas".

The company’s first consumer product was an electric rice cooker.

questions.text: In 2018, E-sports player 'Forsaken' was caught attempting to cheat live on-stage at a tournament. What was his master plan?
questions.additionalText:
He put aimbot software on a cloud drive to download when he sat down at his on-stage computer. Referees thought his gameplay looked suspicious, and he was unable to delete the incriminating files in time.

Apologising later, he said: "Nothing good has happened to me since the day I started playing this game ... I gave everything away for the game, I always put this game above everything else and now I realise what I have lost. I lost everything when I put the game above all else, and now I have lost the game, too.".

options.a: Download cheating software and rename it to 'word.exe'
options.b: Wear special glasses to allow him to see his opponents' screens
options.c: Pour a can of Pepsi on his opponents' keyboards
options.d: Communicate with an audience member via blinking
